definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
see 磅秤 scale/platform balance/(loanword) pound (unit of weight, about 454 grams)

sentences.english: B:Here they are, will you weigh all our luggage together?
sentences.chinese: 这些都是，要不要把我的全部行李一起过磅？

sentences.english: After you have done that, she will weigh your luggage.
sentences.chinese: 办完这之后，她会将你的行李秤重过磅。

sentences.english: Put your baggage on the scale, please.
sentences.chinese: 请将你的行李放在秤上过磅。

sentences.english: Here they are, will you weigh all our luggage together?
sentences.chinese: 嚅，就是这些要不要把我们的全部行李一起过磅？

sentences.english: Ok. Put your baggage on this scale.
sentences.chinese: 好的，请将你的行李放在秤上过磅。

sentences.english: Prior to every shipment the cargo is inspected and weighed by the China Import and Export Commodities Inspection Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 中国进出口商检局在货物装船前进行检验和过磅。

sentences.english: Please weigh in all the suitcases.
Workers were hauling a loaded train by a winch.
sentences.chinese: 工作人员正以绞盘牵引过磅的重车。

sentences.english: Do you think my hand bag should be weighed?
sentences.chinese: 你看我的手滋包要过磅吗？

sentences.english: The passengers took their bags to the airport counter to weigh in.
sentences.chinese: 旅客们把行李拿到机场服务台过磅。

sentences.english: The shipment was weighed before loading.
sentences.chinese: 这批货的装船前都已过磅。

definition: to load sth onto a ship etc
to load or unload/to transfer/to assemble and disassemble
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
to tip/to dump by tipping from a vehicle
to put together an order of goods
